message:
This is more on the beginner side of things

This is a cool website that contains a wide range of tutorials on Javascript and Node.js

The tutorials are interactive node modules with a challenge to solve for every step in the tutorial

The tutorials cover a lot of beignner concepts (Javascript, Git, Node.js) to intermediate (Prototype chains, WebGL, Web audio ... etc.) and more advanced (ES6, Babel) also it covers some server side frameworks like (Express, Hapi) and some front end libraries (React, Lo-Dash)

I didn't use all of the tutorials but the ones I use are really good 

I thought I'd share with you this link, I hope it could be useful to you.
story: Mahmoud Mustafa El-Badry shared a link to the group: Egyptian Geeks.
name: NodeSchool
caption: nodeschool.io
description: These are in-person hosted workshops, usually free, in which workshoppers are used as curriculum and mentors help attendees work through the challenges.
